Status: cleaned, need to properly re-contruct; later, theoretically + empirically test
Rules:
Construct from deservingness ratings of groups framed as needing help (welfare/TANF or SNAP; Medicaid/Medicare/SS; unemployed; poor families; homeless; immigrants/refugees/asylum seekers; uninsured; mentally ill).

Explicitly exclude any justice-adjacent targets (criminals, prisoners/incarcerated, ex-felons, sex offenders, incarcerated parents) to avoid post-treatment bias and DV bleed-through.

Use raw scales (0Ð100 or 1Ð4; just keep them consistent across included items). If mixed, normalize items to a common 0Ð100 scale first (see code).

Compute a row mean with a minimum item threshold (e.g., must have ³3 valid items; otherwise NA).

Save both desor (raw) and desor_z (standardized).

Log it in the Checklist (status ok; definition + missing rule + constructed_in).

Description: mean of 9 assistance-framed targets (0Ð100), require ³5 non-missing; desor_core_z standardized.
Rules: exclude ppl with info in less than 3
